alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 28 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 237 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area through early this morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Frenchville, Portage Lake, New Canada, Fish River Lake, Big Machias Lake, Cross Lake, Madawaska Lake, Lille, Churchill Dam, New Sweden, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Connor, Perham, Caswell, Stockholm and Winterville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
